question: 炊く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>cook</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to cook</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to boil</vocabulary>. Often it has to do with cooking grains (<vocabulary>to cook grains</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic: When you cook something, it's like you're a<reading>ttack</reading>ing (<ja>たく</ja>) the food with boiling water or fire or whatever. Attack the food by cooking it!
